message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.CC, cs.CR 

This paper deals with the problem of classifying inputs based on certain rules and linear classifiers. This falls under the domain of machine learning and artificial intelligence, which are covered by the cs.LG and cs.AI sub-categories. The paper also discusses experiments on sentiment analysis data, which is a common application of natural language processing, falling under the cs.CL sub-category. The paper also mentions sample complexity and efficient algorithms, which are topics covered by the cs.CC sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the potential for failures in complex classifiers, which is a topic covered by the cs.CR sub-category.
